sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a circle.
message_1: A circular garden has a diameter of 10 meters. What is the perimeter of the garden, in meters?
message_2:
The perimeter of a circle is given by the formula P = 2πr, where P is the perimeter and r is the radius of the circle. Since the diameter of the garden is 10 meters, the radius is half of that, which is 5 meters.

P = 2πr
P = 2π(5)
P = 10π

The perimeter of the garden is 10π meters, which is approximately 31.42 meters.
